Success The creature takes @Damage[4d10[vitality]] or @Damage[4d10[void]] damage (whichever is more harmful).

Failure The creature takes @Damage[8d10[vitality]] or @Damage[8d10[void]] damage (whichever is more harmful) and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1}.

Critical Failure As failure but @Damage[16d10[vitality]] or @Damage[16d10[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}.

Perilous Flash Flood.name: Perilous Flash Flood
Perilous Flash Flood.descriptionHazard: Whether made up of water rushing through the streets that sweeps up dangerous debris along the way or a less natural substance bursting free of its container, this relentless flood batters everything in its path.
Perilous Flash Flood.disable: Three @Check[type:athletics|dc:35|name:Move Barricade], @Check[type:crafting|dc:35|name:Construct Barricade], or @Check[type:survival|dc:35|name:Construct Barricade] checks to move or construct barricades strong enough to create a shelter from the flood. While this creates a safe place to stand, creatures outside of the barricaded area may still be in danger depending on the nature and the source of the flood.
Perilous Flash Flood.routine:
(1 action) The flood advances forward 60 feet, crashing into all creatures within its area. Each creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30] save as the floodwaters pummel them and pull them downstream. The amount and type of damage dealt are based on the nature of the flood, and certain types of floods impose additional effects. The turbulent waters mean creatures within the area of the flood must attempt a @Check[type:athletics|dc:20|name:Swim|traits:action:swim] check to Swim in order to move, and those who do not succeed at a check to Swim each round may drown.

This caustic flood dissolves flesh as it moves, dealing @Damage[1d12[bludgeoning],(1d12+8)[acid]]{1d12 bludgeoning damage and 1d12+8 acid damage}. Additionally, it deals @Damage[2d6[persistent,acid]] damage to creatures who critically fail their Fortitude saves.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes half damage.

Failure The creature takes full damage and is moved 10 feet along with the water.

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage and is moved 20 feet along with the water.

action->Burst Free.name: Burst Free
action->Burst Free.description:
Trigger A creature or effect breaks the flood's containment.

Effect The hazard rolls initiative as the flood surges forth.

weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate, Infused).name: Acid Flask (Moderate, Infused)
weapon->Acid Flask (Moderate, Infused).description:
Activate A Strike

This flask filled with corrosive acid deals 1 acid damage, 2d6 persistent acid damage, and 2 acid splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

weapon->Frost Vial (Moderate, Infused).name: Frost Vial (Moderate, Infused)
weapon->Frost Vial (Moderate, Infused).description:
Activate 1 Strike

The liquid reagents in this vial rapidly absorb heat when exposed to air. A frost vial deals the listed cold damage and cold splash damage. On a hit, the target takes a status penalty to its Speeds until the end of its next turn. Many types of frost vial also grant an item bonus to attack rolls.

You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls, the bomb deals 2d6 cold damage and 2 cold splash damage, and the target takes a -10-foot penalty.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.dv0IKm5syOdP759w]{Effect: Frost Vial (Moderate)}

consumable->Antidote (Lesser, Infused).name: Antidote (Lesser, Infused)
consumable->Antidote (Lesser, Infused).description:
Activate A Interact

An antidote protects you against toxins. Upon drinking an antidote, you gain a +2 item bonus to Fortitude saving throws against poisons for 6 hours.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-effects.Item.7z1iY4AaNEAIKuAU]{Effect: Antidote (Lesser)}

consumable->Smokestick (Lesser, Infused).name: Smokestick (Lesser, Infused)
consumable->Smokestick (Lesser, Infused).description:
Activate A Interact

With a sharp twist of this item, you instantly create a screen of thick, opaque smoke in a burst centered on one corner of your space. All creatures within that area are concealed, and all other creatures are concealed to them. The smoke lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind.

The radius of the burst is 5 feet.

action->Infused Items.name: Infused Items
action->Infused Items.description: Pesgahi carries the following infused items, which last for 24 hours or until the next time he makes his daily preparations: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ktjFOp3U0wQD9t0Z]{Antidote (Lesser)} (2), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MoBlVd36uD9xVvZC]{Smokestick (Lesser)} (2), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.SgtqZxt26BdjUmEB]{Acid Flask (Moderate)} (6), @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.nVvH1ZcM7OwIVIs8]{Frost Vial (Moderate)} (4)

action->Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
action->Consume Flesh.description:
Requirements Pesgahi is adjacent to the corpse of a creature that died within the last hour.

Effect Pesgahi devours a chunk of the corpse and regains [[/r 2d6[healing]]] Hit Points.

He can regain Hit Points from any given corpse only once.

action->Ghoul Fever.name: Ghoul Fever
action->Ghoul Fever.description:
Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19]

Stage 1 carrier with no ill effect (1 day)

Stage 2 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and regains half as many Hit Points from all healing (1 day)

Stage 3 as stage 2 (1 day)

Stage 4 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage and gains no benefit from healing (1 day)

Stage 5 as stage 4 (1 day)

Stage 6 dead, and rises as a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.pathfinder-bestiary.Actor.LHHgGSs0ELCR4CYK]{Ghoul} the next midnight.

action->Paralysis.name: Paralysis
action->Paralysis.description: Any living, non-elf creature hit by Pesgahi's attack must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:19] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. It can attempt a new save at the end of each of its turns, and the DC cumulatively decreases by 1 on each such save.

action->Quick Bomber.name: Quick Bomber
action->Quick Bomber.description: Pesgahi can use Interact to draw a bomb and then Strike with it.

action->Swift Leap.name: Swift Leap
action->Swift Leap.description: Pesgahi jumps up to half his Speed. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

Phalanx of Phalanges.name: Phalanx of Phalanges
Phalanx of Phalanges.publicNotes:
Made up of hundreds of finger and toe bones, a phalanx of phalanges clatters along the ground in an eerily uniform manner.

Commonly mistaken for undead, animated bones are mindless constructs with no connection to necromancy. The following are examples of typical animated bones.

action->Predetermined Path.name: Predetermined Path
action->Predetermined Path.description: A phalanx of phalanges knows a single path on even ground no longer than 100 feet, as determined by its creator. The phalanx of phalanges makes no actions other than moving along this path or making Countless Digits attacks against creatures in its way. If impeded on this path or if it takes damage, the phalanx of phalanges is unbound from its path and is permanently berserk, attacking nearby creatures to the best of its ability.

action->Countless Digits.name: Countless Digits
action->Countless Digits.description: Each other creature in the phalanx of phalanges' space takes @Damage[1d6[piercing]] damage (@Damage[(1d6+2)[piercing]] damage if the swarm is berserk) (@Check[type:reflex|dc:17|basic:true]). On a critical failure, the target is thoroughly pinned by the phalanges, becoming @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} until it @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} (DC 17) or until any creature uses 2 Interact actions to scrape away the bones pinning them down.

Phantom Soldiers.name: Phantom Soldiers
Phantom Soldiers.descriptionHazard: Spirits of long-dead soldiers appear in the mist and attack intruders.
Phantom Soldiers.disable: @Check[type:intimidation|dc:45] (legendary) to scare off the soldiers or @Check[type:deception|dc:46] (legendary) to order the soldiers to stand down

action->Battle.name: Battle
action->Battle.description:
Trigger A creature enters the area

Effect Spirit soldiers lunge out of the mist and attack intruders. The spirit soldiers attempt a spear Strike against each creature within 30 feet.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/br 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

action->Sacrilegious Aura.name: Sacrilegious Aura
action->Sacrilegious Aura.description: 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a vitality spell or ability, Pokmit automatically attempts to counteract it, with a [[/r 1d20+29 #Counteract]]{+29} counteract modifier.

action->Devastating Blast.name: Devastating Blast
action->Devastating Blast.description: Pokmit unleashes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of cold. Creatures in the area take @Damage[10d12[cold]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:40|basic:true]). The graveknight can use this ability once every [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Graveknight's Curse.name: Graveknight's Curse
action->Graveknight's Curse.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:44] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, hampered 10, and can't remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight

action->Pike Master.name: Pike Master
action->Pike Master.description: Pokmit's longspear reach increases by 5 feet until the start of his next turn, and he makes a single longspear Strike against any number of creatures. These attacks count toward Pokmit's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after all the attacks.

action->Pokmit's Discernment.name: Pokmit's Discernment
action->Pokmit's Discernment.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect Pokmit sizes up the defenses of a creature within 30 feet; he must know the creature is near, but need not be able to see it. Until the start of Pokmit's next turn, Pokmit's attacks against the target ignore any flat check required due to the target being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}.

action->Ruinous Weapons.name: Ruinous Weapons
action->Ruinous Weapons.description: Any weapon or unarmed attack Pokmit uses gains the effects of the +1 greater striking and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Sexud7FdxIrg50vU]{Greater Frost} weapons runes. (These bonuses are included in his statistics above.)

action->Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
action->Weapon Master.description: Pokmit has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons he wields.

Prachalla.name: Prachalla
Prachalla.publicNotes:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal's soul. These little constructs are created for a variety of reasons-such as to serve as companions or servants-but their free will means their obedience to their creators is hardly a given. Followers of Pharasma generally abhor soulbound dolls, viewing them as a perversion of the natural cycle of souls, and those who worship the Lady of Graves see the destruction of a soulbound doll, regardless of the construct's alignment, as an important service to the Great Beyond. Soulbound dolls are the simplest in a series of soulbound constructs including human-sized soulbound mannequins, powerful soulbound shells, and sentinel soulbound terra-cotta warriors. Creating them from unwilling living creatures is evil, and an unwilling donor can resist the process with a successful Will save against the creator's Craft DC, ruining the doll if not preventing the donor's death. A non-evil doll can only be crafted from the soul of a person who has given consent to such use before their death occurred

Soulbound dolls encountered by adventurers are typically guardians of some sort; despite their diminutive size, the soul fragment's power makes the doll's flst more dangerous than a casual observer would expect. Further, it grants the doll a single spell of outsized power given its stature. Because of their autonomy and remarkable intelligence, soulbound dolls are occasionally employed by their crafters as administrators over much more powerful but mindless constructs such as golems, allowing such dolls to control defenses far beyond their own capabilities. Though soulbound dolls contain a small fragment of a soul extracted during or shortly after a person's death, this doesn't affect the deceased's resurrection or progress to the afterlife. This extraction process is lethal to otherwise-living prospective soul donors, though there are rumors of more expensive processes that allows someone to donate a fragment of a living soul without repercussions.

The soul fragment resides in a soul focus gem typically embedded in the doll's neck or chest. The soul fragment isn't static, and the doll continues to learn from its initial state, meaning its personality and abilities can change, possibly growing closer to the donor's or moving farther afield on its own individual path. The soulbound doll's focus gem retains the doll's memories even after the doll's destruction. The the intact soul focus gem of a destroyed doll can even be placed into a new doll body by someone knowledgeable in the creation of soulbound creatures, effectively reconstituting the soulbound doll.

action->Personality Fragments.name: Personality Fragments
action->Personality Fragments.description: A soulbound doll shares fragments of the donor's soul personality, though none of that creature's memories. The Prachalla doll is animated by the soul of a spy who worked for an organized crime ring in Kaer Maga; she was working undercover as a maid when she died.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Prachalla deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Prachalla.

Precarious Bone Pile.name: Precarious Bone Pile
Precarious Bone Pile.descriptionHazard: This ancient pile of bones appears stable, but the slightest disturbance topples them.
Precarious Bone Pile.disable: @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:20] (trained) or @Check[type:stealth|dc:20] (trained) to shimmy past the bones without disturbing them, or deal any amount of damage to trigger the collapse from a distance

action->Collapse.name: Collapse
action->Collapse.description:
Trigger A creature moves through the treacherous squares near the bone pile or damages the bones piled in one of the squares

Effect The bone pile collapses in a torrent of skeletal remains, spreading 5 feet in every direction from the bone pile's current area. This deals @Damage[(6d4+9)[bludgeoning]] damage to each creature within 5 feet of the bone pile (@Check[type:reflex|dc:20|basic:true]). The area becomes difficult terrain.

Prince Doriel.name: Prince Doriel
Prince Doriel.publicNotes:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal's soul. These little constructs are created for a variety of reasons-such as to serve as companions or servants-but their free will means their obedience to their creators is hardly a given. Followers of Pharasma generally abhor soulbound dolls, viewing them as a perversion of the natural cycle of souls, and those who worship the Lady of Graves see the destruction of a soulbound doll, regardless of the construct's alignment, as an important service to the Great Beyond. Soulbound dolls are the simplest in a series of soulbound constructs including human-sized soulbound mannequins, powerful soulbound shells, and sentinel soulbound terra-cotta warriors. Creating them from unwilling living creatures is evil, and an unwilling donor can resist the process with a successful Will save against the creator's Craft DC, ruining the doll if not preventing the donor's death. A non-evil doll can only be crafted from the soul of a person who has given consent to such use before their death occurred

Soulbound dolls encountered by adventurers are typically guardians of some sort; despite their diminutive size, the soul fragment's power makes the doll's flst more dangerous than a casual observer would expect. Further, it grants the doll a single spell of outsized power given its stature. Because of their autonomy and remarkable intelligence, soulbound dolls are occasionally employed by their crafters as administrators over much more powerful but mindless constructs such as golems, allowing such dolls to control defenses far beyond their own capabilities. Though soulbound dolls contain a small fragment of a soul extracted during or shortly after a person's death, this doesn't affect the deceased's resurrection or progress to the afterlife. This extraction process is lethal to otherwise-living prospective soul donors, though there are rumors of more expensive processes that allows someone to donate a fragment of a living soul without repercussions.

The soul fragment resides in a soul focus gem typically embedded in the doll's neck or chest. The soul fragment isn't static, and the doll continues to learn from its initial state, meaning its personality and abilities can change, possibly growing closer to the donor's or moving farther afield on its own individual path. The soulbound doll's focus gem retains the doll's memories even after the doll's destruction. The the intact soul focus gem of a destroyed doll can even be placed into a new doll body by someone knowledgeable in the creation of soulbound creatures, effectively reconstituting the soulbound doll.

equipment->Ring of Energy Resistance (Gr.name: Ring of Energy Resistance (Greater) (Acid)
equipment->Ring of Energy Resistance (Gr.description: This ring bears the Brozan family crest and grants you resistance 10 against one type of energy damage: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. Each ring is crafted to protect against a particular type of energy damage, and its design usually embodies the type of energy it protects the wearer from in some way. For instance, a ring of fire resistance might be capped with a ruby, whereas a ring of cold resistance features a sapphire instead.

action->Personality Fragments.name: Personality Fragments
action->Personality Fragments.description: A soulbound doll shares fragments of the donor's soul personality, though none of that creature's memories. The Doriel doll is animated by Kerinza's idealized version of her childhood friend. He can telepathically communicate with the Kerinza doll as long as they're within 60 feet of each other.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Prince Doriel deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Prince Doriel.

Princess Kerinza.name: Princess Kerinza
Princess Kerinza.publicNotes:

action->Personality Fragments.name: Personality Fragments
action->Personality Fragments.description: The Kerinza doll is animated by a piece of Kerinza's soul, energized by the happiest time in her life. She can telepathically communicate with the Doriel doll as long as they're within 60 feet of each other. If the Doriel doll is defeated, her eyes turn black, and black veins run beneath her porcelain skin. She can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.GaRQlC9Yw1BGKHfN]{Wave of Despair} again if she's already cast it, and she can cast it as a single action.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Princess Kerinza deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to Princess Kerinza.

Psychic Wave.name: Psychic Wave
Psychic Wave.descriptionHazard: A wave of psychic energy ripples through the room, violently prying into the minds of creatures in the area and alerting Kemnebi to the presence of intruders.
Psychic Wave.disable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:50] (legendary) to stymie the psychic energy before it manifests

action->Psychic Assault.name: Psychic Assault
action->Psychic Assault.description:
Trigger A creature has been in the room for more than 1 round

Effect A wave of psychic energy slams into the minds of creatures in the chamber, dealing @Damage[(8d10+48)[mental]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:44|basic:true]). On a failed save, a creature is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3}.

Pyrogeist.name: Pyrogeist
Pyrogeist.publicNotes: Born from the deaths of arsonists who died in the fires they started, pyrogeists are roiling infernos whose spectral fire emits no actual heat and harms only living creatures. Obsessed with sharing their torment with the living, pyrogeists haunt the area of their demise until whatever wrong they refuse to forgive has been righted, and they are finally put to rest. While pyrogeists can't set their own fires, they often use their terrifying illusory capabilities and telekinetic powers to lure their victims into setting themselves ablaze.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Vital.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Vitality

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description: When a pyrogeist is destroyed, it reforms where it was destroyed after [[/br 2d4 #Days]]{2d4 days}, fully healed. The pyrogeist can be permanently destroyed only if someone determines the reason for its existence and sets right whatever prevents the spirit from resting.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description: A pyrogeist can spit a cone of spectral fire in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], dealing @Damage[10d6[void]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:29|basic:true]). A creature that fails the save also takes @Damage[1d6[persistent,void]] damage and is subject to the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.HRb2doyaLtaoCfi3]{Faerie Fire} until the persistent damage ends.

action->Pyrokinetic Whirlwind.name: Pyrokinetic Whirlwind
action->Pyrokinetic Whirlwind.description: The pyrogeist transforms into a 40-foot tall vortex of spectral flame that appears to immolate everything within a @Template[type:burst|distance:10]. A creature within this area take [[/r (2d12 + 20)[void]]] damage (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:29|basic:true]).

action->Soul Consumption.name: Soul Consumption
action->Soul Consumption.description: The spirit of a creature that dies from damage dealt by the pyrogeist's Pyrokinetic Whirlwind is trapped within the pyrogeist as if subjected to the effects of the bind soul spell. This effect persists until the pyrogeist is destroyed or chooses to set the soul free. The spirit remains trapped whether or not the pyrogeist is using Pyrokinetic Whirlwind. A pyrogeist can contain only one soul at a time in this manner.

Restored Doll.name: Restored Doll
Restored Doll.publicNotes:
Soulbound dolls are eerie mannequins or playthings that have been imbued with a small piece of a deceased mortal's soul. The soul fragment isn't static, and the doll continues to learn from its initial state, meaning its personality and abilities can change, possibly growing closer to the donor's or moving farther afield on its own individual path. action->Personality Fragments.name: Personality Fragments
action->Personality Fragments.description: A soulbound doll shares fragments of the donor's soul personality, though none of that creature's memories.

action->For You, Mistress.name: For You, Mistress
action->For You, Mistress.description:
Trigger An attack would reduce Kerinza to 0 HP

Requirements The soulbound doll is within 60 feet of Kerinza

Effect The attack is redirected to the soulbound doll, and the doll is destroyed, regardless of the damage dealt to it.

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: The restored doll deals an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

action->Surprise Attack.name: Surprise Attack
action->Surprise Attack.description: On the first round of combat, creatures that haven't acted are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to the restored doll.

Revisit Past Pains.name: Revisit Past Pains
Revisit Past Pains.descriptionHazard: A spirit locked in memories of its death flies down the hall, forcing intruders to experience the agony of its death.
Revisit Past Pains.disable: @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:48] (master) to calm the spirit or @Check[type:occultism|dc:46] (master) to ward off the spirit

action->Share Pain.name: Share Pain
action->Share Pain.description:
Trigger A creature enters the area

Effect Creatures within @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]{30 feet} take @Damage[(6d12+41)[mental]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:40|basic:true]) as they experience the spirit's death.

action->Circling Assault.name: Circling Assault
action->Circling Assault.description: The corpsekiller circles around their target then attacks, throwing their foe off balance and puncturing its defenses. The corpsekiller Steps or Strides, then attempts a glaive Strike. On a hit or critical hit, the Strike ignores 10 of their target's resistances. Regardless of the result of the Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round.

action->Corpsekiller.name: Corpsekiller
action->Corpsekiller.description: A corpsekiller's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal an additional @Damage[2d8[slashing]] damage to undead creatures.

action->Bolster Dead.name: Bolster Dead
action->Bolster Dead.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Your most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip necromancy spell

Effect You harness the residual energy from the spell you last cast into the body of an undead creature within 30 feet. That creature's resistances increase by an amount equal to the rank of the spell cast until the beginning of the next turn.

action->Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
action->Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The necromancer hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect The necromancer expends the power stored in their dagger. This gives them the ability to cast one prepared spell they prepared today and already cast, without spending a spell slot.

Rotbomber.name: Rotbomber
Rotbomber.publicNotes: Disgusting and dangerous, rotbombers bound around on all four limbs, ripping off the pressurized and explosive necrotic pustules that grow out of their backs to lob them toward their enemies. When they explode, the pustules emit concussive blasts of force and deadly pestilence that can infect a victim. Though slow and overburdened by the intense weight of the pustules, rotbombers can move with a surprising speed when they need to hunt down their quarry.

action->Slow.name: Slow
action->Slow.description: A rotbomber is permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} and can't use reactions.

action->Pressurized Pustules.name: Pressurized Pustules
action->Pressurized Pustules.description: When a rotbomber takes acid, fire, physical or sonic damage, there is a chance a prematurely developed pustule bursts open, determined by a @Check[type:flat|dc:11]. All creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] must succeed at @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2}. A creature that gets a critical failure becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3}. Any creature who attempts this save becomes temporarily immune to pressurized pustules for 24 hours.

action->Gaseous Smash.name: Gaseous Smash
action->Gaseous Smash.description:
Frequency once per round

Effect The rotbomber pulls two necrotic pustules from its body, one in each hand, and leaps into the air in an attempt to detonate them simultaneously on a hapless victim. The rotbomber Leaps up to 15 feet horizontally and 10 feet vertically to land in a square adjacent to a target creature and makes a necrotic pustule Strike against the target. If the Strike hits, it deals an additional @Damage[4d6[bludgeoning]] damage to the target. This counts as two attacks for the purposes of determining the rotbomber's multiple attack penalty, but the penalty does not increase until after the Gaseous Smash.

action->Necrotic Rot.name: Necrotic Rot
action->Necrotic Rot.description:
Necrotic rot withers and corrupts living tissue at an alarming rate. An infected creature can't heal damage it takes from necrotic rot until it has been cured of the disease.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29]

Stage 1 @Damage[2d6[void]] damage (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}

Stage 3 @Damage[3d6[void]] damage and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 2}

Stage 4 dead, rising as a rotbomber immediately

action->Propulsive Pestilence.name: Propulsive Pestilence
action->Propulsive Pestilence.description: The pressurized necrotic gases within the rotbomber's pustules make them explode far more dramatically than most alchemists' bombs. The rotbomber's necrotic pustules deal splash damage to every creature within 15 feet of the target.

action->Keen Eyes.name: Keen Eyes
action->Keen Eyes.description: Ruby gains a +2 circumstance bonus when using the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to find @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected} creatures within 30 feet. When she targets an opponent that's @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} or hidden, she reduces the DC of the flat check to @Check[type:flat|dc:3] for a concealed target or @Check[type:flat|dc:9] for a hidden one.

action->Daring Gambit.name: Daring Gambit
action->Daring Gambit.description: Ruby attempts to distract an enemy with a death-defying maneuver. She attempts an @Check[type:acrobatics|defense:reflex] check against the Reflex DC of one target within her melee reach. On a success, Ruby Strides up to 15 feet (or 30 feet on a critical success) without triggering reactions from her target due to her movement, and the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against Ruby's next melee Strike before the end of her turn. Regardless of the result of her Acrobatics check, Ruby attempts a melee Strike against the target.

action->Light Step.name: Light Step
action->Light Step.description: Ruby ignores difficult terrain when she Strides or Steps.

action->Mobile Combatant.name: Mobile Combatant
action->Mobile Combatant.description: Ruby's Strikes deal an additional 4d6 damage if she has moved at least 10 feet during her turn.

action->Timely Boast.name: Timely Boast
action->Timely Boast.description:
Trigger A creature is critically hit by Ruby, or a creature critically misses Ruby

Effect Ruby taunts the triggering creature and boasts about her prowess. Ruby attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the triggering creature.

equipment->Key to all locks in Cerulean.name: Key to all locks in Cerulean Glade

consumable->Wand of Cone of Cold (Level.name: Wand of Cone of Cold (Level 5)
consumable->Wand of Cone of Cold (Level.description:
@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.3puDanGfpEt6jK5k]{Cone of Cold}

This baton is about a foot long and contains a single spell. The appearance typically relates to the spell within.

Activate Cast a Spell

Frequency once per day, plus overcharge

Effect You Cast the Spell at the indicated level.

Craft Requirements Supply a listed-level casting of the spell.

Note: To create a scroll or wand of a specific spell, drag the spell from the compendium or compendium browser into the inventory of a PC, NPC, or loot actor.

backpack->Bag of Holding (Type IV).name: Bag of Holding (Type IV)
backpack->Bag of Holding (Type IV).description:
Though it appears to be a cloth sack decorated with panels of richly colored silk or stylish embroidery, a bag of holding opens into an extradimensional space larger than its outside dimensions. The Bulk held inside the bag doesn't change the Bulk of the bag of holding itself. The amount of Bulk the bag's extradimensional space can hold depends on its type.

You can Interact with the bag of holding to put items in or remove them just like a mundane sack. Though the bag can hold a great amount of material, an object still needs to be able to fit through the opening of the sack to be stored inside.

If the bag is overloaded or broken, it ruptures and is ruined, causing the items inside to be lost forever. If it's turned inside out, the items inside spill out unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. A living creature placed inside the bag has enough air for 10 minutes before it begins to suffocate, and it can attempt to Escape against a DC of 13. An item inside the bag provides no benefits unless it's retrieved first. An item in the bag can't be detected by magic that detects only things on the same plane.

Capacity 150 Bulk

action->Evasion.name: Evasion
action->Evasion.description: If Rumin rolls a success on a Reflex save, he gets a critical success instead.

action->Susceptible to Mockery.name: Susceptible to Mockery
action->Susceptible to Mockery.description:
A character can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} Rumin by mocking the fact that he hasn't yet been turned into a vampire. On a success, in addition to the normal effects, Rumin becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 3} on a critical success), but on a critical failure he becomes enraged and gains a +1 status bonus to Strikes and damage rolls against foes for 1 minute, during which time he can't be mocked further.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.APJJCYdq4gNe0PF4]{Effect: Susceptible to Mockery (Critical Failure)}

action->Sneak Attack.name: Sneak Attack
action->Sneak Attack.description: Rumin's Strikes deal an additional 2d6 precision damage to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} creatures.

Rust Hag.name: Rust Hag
Rust Hag.publicNotes:
Rust hags have a knack for technology. They make their homes in hollowed-out factories, abandoned tenements, and other sites of urban decay.

Hags are surprisingly diverse, both in abilities and in their terrain.
Rust Hag.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

consumable->Rounds (Arquebus).name: Rounds (Arquebus)
consumable->Rounds (Arquebus).description: Firearms require ammunition consisting of a projectile and black powder. A round of ammo can vary in its composition but is typically either a prepackaged paper cartridge, including wadding, bullet, and black powder, or loose shot packed in manually. Some weapons, like hand cannons and blunderbusses, can fire other materials, but their ammunition has the same Price due to the cost of the black powder. Because making rounds of firearm ammunition requires creating black powder, you need the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.is3Oz9wt11lNq62K]{Alchemical Crafting} skill feat to make them. Firearm rounds are a valid option for magical ammunition, just like arrows or bolts. Crafting magical firearm ammunition requires you to be able to craft both alchemical and magical items.

consumable->Rounds (Flintlock Pistol).name: Rounds (Flintlock Pistol)
consumable->Rounds (Flintlock Pistol).description: Firearms require ammunition consisting of a projectile and black powder. A round of ammo can vary in its composition but is typically either a prepackaged paper cartridge, including wadding, bullet, and black powder, or loose shot packed in manually. Some weapons, like hand cannons and blunderbusses, can fire other materials, but their ammunition has the same Price due to the cost of the black powder. Because making rounds of firearm ammunition requires creating black powder, you need the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.is3Oz9wt11lNq62K]{Alchemical Crafting} skill feat to make them. Firearm rounds are a valid option for magical ammunition, just like arrows or bolts. Crafting magical firearm ammunition requires you to be able to craft both alchemical and magical items.

action->Coven.name: Coven
action->Coven.description: A rust hag adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse Of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0fYE64odlKqISzft]{Rusting Grasp}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct} to her coven's spells.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Change Shape.name: Change Shape
action->Change Shape.description:
The rust hag can take on the appearance of any Medium female humanoid. This doesn't change her Speed or her Strikes, but might change the damage type her Strikes deal (typically to bludgeoning).

@Localize[PF2E.NPC.Abilities.Glossary.ChangeShape]

action->Hagshot.name: Hagshot
action->Hagshot.description: Any firearm wielded by a rust hag gains the benefits of +1 striking and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} runes, and it functions properly no matter how rusty it gets. In addition, when a rust hag critically hits a target with a firearm, the target must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:26] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1}.

action->Rusting Touch.name: Rusting Touch
action->Rusting Touch.description: A rust hag's touch causes metal to rapidly rust and corrode. If the hag succeeds at a Strike with her claw, she deals [[/r 2d6 #Rusting Touch Damage]] damage (doubled on a critical hit) to a metal item the target is wearing or holding, ignoring its Hardness. If the hag hits an unattended metal item, the item takes this damage automatically. If a creature uses the Shield Block reaction with a metal shield against the hag's claw attack, the shield is automatically broken, but no other item is rusted on that attack. Objects made of skymetal, such as adamantine and orichalcum, are immune to rusting touch.

Sahni Bride-Of-The-Sea.name: Sahni Bride-Of-The-Sea
Sahni Bride-Of-The-Sea.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Coven.name: Coven
action->Coven.description: Sahni adds @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.z2mfh3oPnfYqXflY]{Mariner's Curse}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk} to her coven's spells.

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Bride's Bargain.name: Bride's Bargain
action->Bride's Bargain.description: Sahni can make a bargain with a willing creature of sound mind. The creature gives away a special quality-such as its courage, beauty, or voice-or sacrifices a loved one in exchange for a boon or a promise from Sahni. As long as Sahni keeps her end of the bargain, the only way to restore a lost quality is to defeat Sahni or make another bargain for its return. Loved ones sacrificed for Sahni's bargain can't be restored except with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.6dDtGIUerazSHIOu]{Wish}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YfJTXyVGzLhM6V8U]{Miracle}, or similarly powerful magic.

action->Curse of Futility.name: Curse of Futility
action->Curse of Futility.description:
Sahni gazes upon a creature, affecting it with an overwhelming sense that every action it takes is futile; that humiliating failure is their only possible future. The target attempts a @Check[type:will|dc:25] save; the target doesn't need to be able to see Sahni.

Critical Success The target is unaffected and temporarily immune to Sahni's Curse of Futility for 24 hours.

Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round and then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Failure The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is stupefied 2 for 1 hour and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} as long as it is stupefied.

action->Scattered Coven.name: Scattered Coven
action->Scattered Coven.description: As a scattered coven, the Graveclaw grants Sahni the ability to cast the following spells as 3rd-rank occult spells, once per day each, without requiring help from her fellow coven members: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.f8hRqLJaxBVhF1u0]{Acid Arrow}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B3eLlbaPxOYHcs1o]{Curse Of Lost Time}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.gPvtmKMRpg9I9D7H]{Earthbind}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.wdA52JJnsuQWeyqz]{Harm}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xlRv8vCTHh1NeMpw]{Mimic Undead}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.Seaah9amXg70RKw2]{Water Walk}. If Sahni is the third hag they confront, the coven is broken and she lacks these coven spells.

action->Entangling Net.name: Entangling Net
action->Entangling Net.description: A Sallowdrudge uses their net to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} a Medium or smaller creature within 30 feet. On a success, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} until it Escapes (DC 16) or until an adjacent creature Interacts to remove the net. On a critical hit, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} rather than grabbed. The Sallowdrudge can't use Entangling Net again until they take 1 minute to refold their net.

action->Spear Fisher.name: Spear Fisher
action->Spear Fisher.description: A Sallowdrudge attacking an @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} target rolls the attack roll twice and takes the better result.

Scrabbling Ribcage.name: Scrabbling Ribcage
Scrabbling Ribcage.publicNotes:
The ribs of a scrabbling ribcage are connected to either a sternum or vertebral column, but not both, allowing the ribs to function as legs.

Commonly mistaken for undead, animated bones are mindless constructs with no connection to necromancy. The following are examples of typical animated bones.

action->Scrabble.name: Scrabble
action->Scrabble.description:
Trigger A creature moves away from the scrabbling ribcage, or a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} by the scrabbling ribcage @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escapes} from it

Effect The ribcage Strides or Climbs. This movement doesn't trigger reactions.

action->Skittering Rush.name: Skittering Rush
action->Skittering Rush.description: The scrabbling ribcage Strides or Climbs twice, with its Speeds increased by 10 feet for this movement.

shield->Sturdy Shield (Supreme).name: Sturdy Shield (Supreme)
shield->Sturdy Shield (Supreme).description:
With a superior design and excellent craftsmanship, this steel shield has higher Hardness than its non-magical counterparts, making it harder to break and destroy.

The shield has Hardness 20, HP 160, and BT 80.

action->Iron Command.name: Iron Command
action->Iron Command.description:
Trigger An enemy within 15 feet damages Seldeg

Effect Seldeg puts an impertinent foe who dared harm him in their proper place. He commands the enemy to kneel in obedience. If they refuse, they must pay the price in pain and anguish. The triggering creature must choose one of the following options: the enemy kneels, dropping @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} as a free action, or the enemy refuses and takes @Damage[5d6[mental]] damage. In addition, Seldeg's Strikes against the triggering creature deal an additional 3 damage until the end of his next turn. Seldeg chooses whether the additional damage is spirit or void each time he uses this reaction.

action->Rejuvenation.name: Rejuvenation
action->Rejuvenation.description:
When a graveknight is destroyed, its armor rebuilds its body over the course of [[/br 1d10 #days]]{1d10 days}-or more quickly if the armor is worn by a living host. If the body is destroyed before then, the process restarts.

A graveknight can only be permanently destroyed by obliterating its armor (such as with @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.r7ihOgKv19eJQnik]{Disintegrate}), transporting it to the Forge of Creation, or throwing it into the heart of a volcano.

action->Sacrilegious Aura.name: Sacrilegious Aura
action->Sacrilegious Aura.description: 30 feet. When a creature in the aura uses a vitality spell or ability, the graveknight automatically attempts to counteract it, with a counteract modifier of [[/r 1d20+27 #Counteract]]{+27}.

action->Devastating Blast.name: Devastating Blast
action->Devastating Blast.description: Seldeg unleashes a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of fire. Creatures in the area take @Damage[9d12[fire]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:35|basic:true]). Seldeg can use this ability once every [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Devastating Blast]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Graveknight's Curse.name: Graveknight's Curse
action->Graveknight's Curse.description:
This curse affects anyone who wears a graveknight's armor for at least 1 hour.

Saving Throw @Check[type:will|dc:35] save

Onset 1 hour

Stage 1 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 2 @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 2}, the creature's Speed is reduced by 10, and cannot remove the armor (1 day)

Stage 3 dies and transforms into the armor's graveknight.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.6rnB7nK6J6zF4vea]{Effect: Graveknight's Curse}

action->Phantom Steed.name: Phantom Steed
action->Phantom Steed.description:
HP 130; AC 39, Fort +28, Ref +25, Will +22

Seldeg summons a supernatural mount as per @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.WPKJOhEihhcIm2uQ]{Marvelous Mount} (8th level). Unlike phantom steed, the steed's AC and saving throw bonuses are all 4 levels lower than Seldeg's, and the steed has one-third of Seldeg's Hit Points (rounded down). If the steed is destroyed, Seldeg must wait 1 hour before using this ability again.

action->Ruinous Weapons.name: Ruinous Weapons
action->Ruinous Weapons.description: Any weapon or unarmed attack Seldeg uses gains the effects of the +1 greater striking and greater flaming runes.

action->Unyielding Block.name: Unyielding Block
action->Unyielding Block.description: At the start of each of Seldeg's turns, he gains two additional reactions he can use only to perform a Shield Block.

action->Weapon Master.name: Weapon Master
action->Weapon Master.description: The graveknight has access to the critical specialization effects of any weapons it wields.

action->Phantom Steed.name: Phantom Steed
action->Phantom Steed.description: Summoned by Seldeg's Phantom Steed ability. The steed can walk or fly at a Speed of 80 feet, can walk on water, and ignores natural difficult terrain and can hold its rider's body weight, plus 20 Bulk

Shabti Slayer.name: Shabti Slayer
Shabti Slayer.publicNotes:
Shabtis raised among the secret Pharasmin sect of the Carters Consortium are trained to destroy undead and the necromancers who create them.

Shabtis are facsimiles of the rich and powerful, patched together from shards of other souls and offered as a sacrifice to the Boneyard to suffer for the sins of their creator. Shabtis are unaware they aren't the person they emulate, and most spend an eternity enduring the punishments owed to another while the soul they emulate escapes judgement. Some shabtis discover their nature and often become adrift, drowning in the feelings and memories of their foul creator, with no true purpose and identities of their own.

action->Final Rest.name: Final Rest
action->Final Rest.description: A shabti slayer's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal @Damage[2d10[vitality]] damage to undead creatures.

action->Immortal.name: Immortal
action->Immortal.description: Shabtis don't age naturally and can't die of old age. Spells and effects that cause aging still affect a shabti as normal. They also can't be turned into undead.

action->Prayer-Blessed Blade.name: Prayer-Blessed Blade
action->Prayer-Blessed Blade.description:
Requirements The shabti slayer has successfully identified an undead with Recall Knowledge

Effect The shabti slayer prays to Pharasma to bless their weapon, enabling them to exploit the weaknesses of an undead they've identified with Recall Knowledge. If the identified undead has a resistance that can be bypassed by a special material or a weakness to a special material (such as cold iron, duskwood, or silver), weapons wielded by the shabti slayer count as that special material for 1 minute. If the creature has multiple materials that qualify, the shabti slayer chooses which material their weapon counts as for the duration.

action->Quick Draw.name: Quick Draw
action->Quick Draw.description: The shabti slayer draws a weapon using the Interact action, then Strikes with that weapon.

action->Two-Weapon Flurry.name: Two-Weapon Flurry
action->Two-Weapon Flurry.description:
Frequency once per round

Requirements A shabti slayer is wielding two melee weapons, each in a different hand

Effect A slayer lashes out with both weapons. They Strike twice, once with each weapon.

Shabti Votary.name: Shabti Votary
Shabti Votary.publicNotes:
Shabti votaries are devout clerics of Pharasma who heal and protect their allies while destroying enemies of their faith. Although shabti votaries focus primarily on destroying undead, they remain a potent enemy against living foes.

Shabtis are facsimiles of the rich and powerful, patched together from shards of other souls and offered as a sacrifice to the Boneyard to suffer for the sins of their creator. Shabtis are unaware they aren't the person they emulate, and most spend an eternity enduring the punishments owed to another while the soul they emulate escapes judgement. Some shabtis discover their nature and often become adrift, drowning in the feelings and memories of their foul creator, with no true purpose and identities of their own.
Shabti Votary.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. mental and possession

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Menta.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Mental and Possession

action->Discerning Aura.name: Discerning Aura
action->Discerning Aura.description:
30 feet. All undead within the aura glow blue, shedding dim light in a 5-foot radius. Visible undead can't be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} while affected by this aura. Invisible undead are concealed while affected by this aura, rather than being undetected.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.mo4IRyv7GGRBJihU]{Effect: Discerning Aura}

action->Gird in Prayer.name: Gird in Prayer
action->Gird in Prayer.description:
Trigger An ally within the shabti votary's aura is the target of a death, mental, or possession effect

Effect The shabti votary girds their ally in protective prayers. The triggering creature gains a +2 status bonus to saving throws against death, mental, and possession effects until the beginning of the shabti votary's next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.bestiary-effects.Item.VLOvyQiZKeXppS2L]{Effect: Gird in Prayer}

action->Immortal.name: Immortal
action->Immortal.description: Shabtis don't age naturally and can't die of old age. Spells and effects that cause aging still affect a shabti as normal. They also can't be turned into undead.

action->Cremate Undead.name: Cremate Undead
action->Cremate Undead.description: A shabti votary's vitality energy sets undead alight. When a shabti votary uses a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.rfZpqmj0AIIdkVIs]{Heal} spell to damage undead, each undead that takes damage also takes persistent fire damage equal to the spell's rank.

action->Expand Aura.name: Expand Aura
action->Expand Aura.description:
Frequency once per turn

Effect The shabti votary focuses their will, expanding the area of their discerning aura by 20 feet for 1 minute. This expansion is cumulative with other uses of Expand Aura.

Shadow Heart.name: Shadow Heart
Shadow Heart.descriptionHazard: A heart of tumorous, shadowy tissue unleashes magic on nearby creatures.
Shadow Heart.disable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:26] or @Check[type:occultism|dc:26] (expert) to counter the heart's offensive magic, or @Check[type:religion|dc:28] (trained) to purify the area containing the heart. Four successes are required to disable it; after two successes, the shadow heart can't use its shadow lash Strike.
Shadow Heart.reset: The heart deactivates if there are no creatures present in the room. It resets in 1 hour.
Shadow Heart.routine: The shadow heart uses Battering Vortex, and then uses shadow lash on a random creature within range.

action->Shadow Pulse.name: Shadow Pulse
action->Shadow Pulse.description:
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of the heart

Effect The heart gives a slow beat, and all creatures in the room must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:30] save or be @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and unable to take reactions for 1 round (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure). The dark heart then rolls initiative.

action->Battering Vortex.name: Battering Vortex
action->Battering Vortex.description:
A swirling vortex of shadows forms around the heart, lifting all creatures in the room and slamming them forcefully to the ground, dealing @Damage[4d10[bludgeoning]] damage. Each creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30] save. Anyone adjacent to a wall may @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} with a successful @Check[type:reflex|dc:28] save; on a success at Grabbing an Edge, the creature uses a result one step better than the roll of their Fortitude save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and is knocked @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

Failure The creature takes full damage, is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} for 1 round.

Critical Failure The creature takes full damage, is knocked prone, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 3} for 1 round.

Shadow Hooks.name: Shadow Hooks
Shadow Hooks.descriptionHazard: Hooks of solidified shadow extend from the walls, hook into creatures, and pull, tearing them open.

action->Tearing Hooks.name: Tearing Hooks
action->Tearing Hooks.description:
Trigger A creature reaches the hall's midpoint

Effect The trap attempts a shadow hook Strike against each creature in the hall. On a critical hit, a creature additionally takes @Damage[1d10[bleed]] damage.

Shadow Lash.name: Shadow Lash
Shadow Lash.descriptionHazard: Four pillars manifest shadow lashes that attack intruders.
Shadow Lash.disable: @Check[type:arcana|dc:46] (legendary) to drain the magic from each shadow lash or @Check[type:thievery|dc:48] (legendary) to disable each shadow lash
Shadow Lash.routine: (8 actions) This trap loses 2 actions each turn for each disabled shadow lash. Each shadow lash has 2 actions it can use to perform the following actions.

action->Long-Rage Lash.name: Long-Rage Lash
action->Long-Rage Lash.description: The lash lengthens, increasing its reach to 60 feet, and makes a lash Strike. The lash's length then reverts to normal.

action->Manifest.name: Manifest
action->Manifest.description:
Trigger A creature other than Kemnebi enters the chamber

Effect Four pillars manifest a writhing whip composed of solidified shadows. The trap then rolls initiative.

Shadow Leydroth.name: Shadow Leydroth
Shadow Leydroth.publicNotes:
In ancient times, a cabal of primalists imbued an amalgam of beasts with both supernatural might and a hatred of magic itself, hoping to achieve a potent weapon for use against arcane spellcasters. Effective beyond expectation, the first leydroths broke free and turned on their creators. Worse, the leydroths bred true, and these reclusive predators have long outlived their original creators.

Leydroths look like distorted, apelike felines with many-branching horns growing from the backs of their heads. Their thickly muscled limbs end in glowing claws.
Shadow Leydroth.allSavesBonus: +2 status to all saves vs. magic

action->Magic Sense.name: Magic Sense
action->Magic Sense.description: The leydroth detects the source and school of each source of magic within 60 feet as an imprecise sense.

action->Slink in Shadows.name: Slink in Shadows
action->Slink in Shadows.description: The Shadow Leydroth can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or end its @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a creature's or object's shadow.

action->+2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +2 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Menace to Magic.name: Menace to Magic
action->Menace to Magic.description:
Trigger A creature within 60 feet Casts a Spell

Effect The leydroth attempts an @Check[type:intimidation] check to counteract the triggering spell.

action->Dispelling Roar.name: Dispelling Roar
action->Dispelling Roar.description:
The leydroth unleashes a bestial roar that reverberates within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. It rolls an Intimidation check and compares the result to the Will DC of each creature in the area, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}.

It also uses this result to attempt to counteract each spell or magical effect in the area, plus one item or effect on each creature in the area, with the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}.

The leydroth can't use Dispelling Roar again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Dispelling Roar]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Dispelling Strike.name: Dispelling Strike
action->Dispelling Strike.description:
Frequency once per round

Trigger The leydroth hits a creature, object, or spell effect with a Strike

Effect The leydroth casts its innate @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}, targeting one effect on the creature struck.

action->Spell Feedback.name: Spell Feedback
action->Spell Feedback.description: Any time a leydroth counteracts a spell or item, the spell's caster or the creature holding the item takes @Damage[8d6[mental]] damage (@Check[type:will|dc:38|basic:true] save).

Shadow Worm.name: Shadow Worm
Shadow Worm.publicNotes: Shadow worms are monstrous cave worms that dwell on the Shadow Plane. Larger and more cunning than most cave worms, shadow worms are fearsome predators that leave swaths of devastation in their wake. Most have glossy, black-armored hide, but those that burrow near velstrac lands are streaked with dark red, for the blood the velstracs spill has soaked into the very stones these shadow worms consume.

action->Inexorable.name: Inexorable
action->Inexorable.description: The shadow worm recovers from the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed}, and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} conditions at the end of its turn. It's also immune to penalties to its Speeds and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized} condition, and it ignores difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain.

action->Shadow Healing.name: Shadow Healing
action->Shadow Healing.description: As long as a shadow worm is in an area of dim light or darkness, it gains fast healing 20. When affected by a magical shadow effect from anything other than itself, a shadow worm becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} 1 for 1 round.

action->Shrink from the Light.name: Shrink from the Light
action->Shrink from the Light.description: A shadow worm takes an additional 20 damage from any spell or ability with the light trait and uses the outcome one degree worse for saving throws made against a spell or ability with the light trait.

action->Breath Weapon.name: Breath Weapon
action->Breath Weapon.description: The shadow worm exhales a blast of clinging shadow, dealing @Damage[11d6[cold],10d6[void]]{11d6 cold damage and 10d6 void damage} to creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:60] (@Check[type:reflex|dc:42|basic:true]). If the cone passes through an area of magical light or targets a creature affected by magical light, Breath Weapon attempts to counteract the light ([[/br 1d20+34 #Counteract]]{+34} counteract modifier). The shadow worm can't use Breath Weapon again for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Breath Weapon]]{1d4 rounds}.

action->Fast Swallow.name: Fast Swallow
action->Fast Swallow.description:
Trigger The shadow worm Grabs a creature

Effect The worm uses Swallow Whole.

action->Rock Tunneler.name: Rock Tunneler
action->Rock Tunneler.description: A shadow worm can burrow through solid stone at a Speed of 20 feet. It can leave a tunnel if it desires, and it usually does.

action->Thrash.name: Thrash
action->Thrash.description: The worm makes a Strike once against each creature in its reach. It can Strike up to once with its jaws and any number of times with its body. Each attack counts toward the worm's multiple attack penalty, but the multiple attack penalty doesn't increase until after it makes all the attacks.

Shadowbound Monk Statue.name: Shadowbound Monk Statue
Shadowbound Monk Statue.publicNotes:
As with any humanoid animated statues of Medium size, giant animated statues are used to guard locations of importance, but their increased size and power make them most useful in large vaults, spacious chambers, or outdoor locations. Animated objects of this strength and size are ideal for tasks and responsibilities usually performed by golems, and more powerful animated objects are thus all but unheard of.

Granted a semblance of life through the use of rituals or other strange magic, animated objects take many forms and serve a variety of uses. A few examples of typical animated objects are listed below. Many of these creatures serve as guardians, surprising unsuspecting adventurers when they suddenly attack. Others serve as idle distractions for the exceptionally rich, simple servants created to handle odd jobs, and the like.

action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).name: Construct Armor (Hardness 10)
action->Construct Armor (Hardness 10).description: Like normal objects, the statue has Hardness. This Hardness reduces any damage it takes by an amount equal to the Hardness. Once the statue is reduced to less than half its Hit Points, or immediately upon being damaged by a critical hit, its construct armor breaks and its Armor Class is reduced to 24.

action->Clinging Gloom.name: Clinging Gloom
action->Clinging Gloom.description: The statue pulls a creature it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} into its grasping shadows. The target takes @Damage[3d8[void]] damage and @Damage[1d8[persistent,void]] damage.

action->Cowl of Shadow.name: Cowl of Shadow
action->Cowl of Shadow.description: Shifting shadows cover the statue. If the statue is dealt at least @Damage[15[vitality]] damage or brought within an area of magical light, the shadows recede, and the statue can't make darkness mote attacks or use Clinging Gloom.

Shadowforged Guardian.name: Shadowforged Guardian
Shadowforged Guardian.publicNotes:
Shadowforged guardians are created through the intricate and dangerous process of siphoning penumbral energies and matter from the Shadow Plane and then binding them to a physical skeleton of wood and metal.

The first shadowforged guardians were created thousands of years ago in Nidal and were usually crafted in the likeness of that nation's patron deity, Zon-Kuthon. Shadowforged guardians are understandably in high demand; unfortunately, only the person who speaks a special word or phrase at the moment of the construct's creation can command it. Those who know the hidden formula to craft these constructs guard the secret well and only a few shadowcasters deign to create these guardians on another person's behalf-for a hefty price.

action->Eager Shadows.name: Eager Shadows
action->Eager Shadows.description: The shadowforged guardian increases all of its Speeds by 30 feet during the first round of combat after rolling initiative.

action->Induction Word.name: Induction Word
action->Induction Word.description: Each shadowforged guardian is activated during creation by a special word or short phrase spoken by its creator, and hearing this induction word resets its functions. If the guardian hears a creature within 30 feet utter its induction word, the guardian must succeed at a @Check[type:will|dc:26] save or become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} (@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 3} on a critical failure). Regardless of the result of this save, it's immune to utterances of its induction word until the end of its next turn.

action->Twilight Aura.name: Twilight Aura
action->Twilight Aura.description: 30 feet. The shadowforged guardian's presence dims light and brightens shadows to a strange, twilit half-light. Light can't emanate brighter than dim light in this area while darkness is simultaneously illuminated to dim light. The shadowy aura automatically attempts to counteract any 5th-rank or lower magical light or darkness effect brought into this aura or created in this area (counteract check [[/r 1d20+21 #Counteract]]{+21}, 5th level). As long as the guardian is in dim light, it gains a fly Speed of 30 feet.

action->Shadow Breath.name: Shadow Breath
action->Shadow Breath.description:
The shadowforged guardian expels a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] of twisting shadows from its mouth. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:29] save. The guardian can't use Shadow Breath for [[/br 1d4 #Recharge Shadow Breath]]{1d4 rounds}.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the end of its next turn.

Failure The creature is enfeebled 1 for 1 hour and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2} for 24 hours and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 2} for 1 minute.

Shimmernewt.name: Shimmernewt
Shimmernewt.publicNotes:
Native to the coastal provinces of eastern Holomog, these strange amphibians have frilled, iridescent gills that appear asymmetrically on either side of their bodies. Random arrays of spots, stripes, and other patterns decorate their flanks, and it's said no two shimmernewts have the same coloration. Originally, shimmernewts were ordinary (if oversized) amphibians, living their lives between brackish coastal lakes or tidal pools and the steamy jungles nearby. Over time, the ambient chaotic energies flowing through Holomog magically altered their evolution. The shimmernewts of today barely resemble their ancestors.

Their inherent chaotic nature has resulted in shimmernewts operating on different cycles from one another. Some are diurnal, some are nocturnal, but most are crepuscular. Shimmernewts that live close to peaceful humanoid settlements are often docile, but wild populations, whether deep in the jungle or in proximity to more violent settlements, can be quite aggressive. When provoked, all shimmernewts can inflate their gills in impressive displays to appear more attractive to mates or more intimidating to rivals. The capricious amphibians lack any natural predators, and conservation- minded locals are trying to prevent them from migrating further inland.

Some underground rings host shimmernewt fights, an unsavory form of entertainment made alluring by lucrative betting. Strolling down the docks of any port town in Holomog for a few minutes provokes whispered invitations to these fights. Though many locals decry these fights as inhumane, each time a ring is shut down, another group pops up sooner or later.

action->Gaping Chomp.name: Gaping Chomp
action->Gaping Chomp.description:
The shimmernewt chews on a creature that it has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}. The target creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24] save.

Critical Success The creature takes no damage.

Success The creature takes @Damage[1d10[piercing]] damage.

Failure The creature takes @Damage[2d10[piercing]] damage and @Damage[1d6[bleed]] damage.

Critical Failure The creature takes @Damage[4d10[piercing]] damage, @Damage[1d6[bleed]] damage, and is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 2} by the pain of the chomp.

action->Shimmer Step.name: Shimmer Step
action->Shimmer Step.description: The shimmernewt surges forward so quickly it slips through space, teleporting to a target for an unexpected attack. The shimmernewt teleports to an empty space adjacent to a creature it can see within 60 feet, then attempts a jaws Strike against the creature. The target creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against this Strike.

action->Trip.name: Trip
action->Trip.description:
Requirements You have at least one hand free. Your target can't be more than one size larger than you

You try to knock a creature to the ground. Attempt an Athletics check against the target's Reflex DC.

Critical Success The target falls and lands @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone} and takes @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage.

Success The target falls and lands prone.

Critical Failure You lose your balance and fall and land prone.

Shoki.name: Shoki
Shoki.publicNotes:
Shokis are shepherds who lead wayward souls to the Boneyard.

Psychopomps preside over death and the cycle of souls.
Shoki.allSavesBonus: +1 status to all saves vs. magic

action->+1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs. Magic

action->Infuse Staff.name: Infuse Staff
action->Infuse Staff.description: A shoki's staff becomes a +1 striking staff and is treated as if it were adamantine while the shoki wields it. A shoki's staff has Hardness 14 and HP 56 (BT 28) while possessed by the shoki or Hardness 5 and HP 20 (BT 10) while out of the shoki's possession. A shoki whose staff is taken or destroyed can infuse a new one with an hour of work.

action->Soul Lock.name: Soul Lock
action->Soul Lock.description:
Requirements The shoki doesn't have a soul locked within their staff

Effect The shoki attempts to capture the soul of a creature on the brink of death: either an undead creature, a creature with the dying condition, or a creature who died within the last minute. The target must attempt a @Check[type:will|dc:32] save with the following results.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected and becomes temporarily immune to Soul Lock.

Success The shoki's staff tugs at the creature's soul but doesn't trap it. If the creature is living, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.3uh1r86TzbQvosxv]{Doomed 1} (or increases its doomed condition by 1). If the creature is a corporeal undead, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 2}. If the creature is an incorporeal undead, it becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2}. The creature then becomes temporarily immune to Soul Lock for 24 hours.

Failure The shoki captures the creature's soul in its staff. If the creature is living, it dies. If the creature is a corporeal undead, its body becomes an inanimate corpse. While the soul is locked in the staff, the target can't be returned to life or undeath, or rejuvenate through any means, save for powerful magic, such as miracle or wish. If the shoki's staff is destroyed or the shoki wills it, the soul is released. A shoki's staff can only hold one soul at a time.

action->Spirit Touch.name: Spirit Touch
action->Spirit Touch.description: A shoki's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures with the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal @Damage[2d6[void]] damage to living creatures and @Damage[2d6[vitality]] damage to undead.

Shrieking Souls.name: Shrieking Souls
Shrieking Souls.descriptionHazard: A terrified soul releases an earsplitting scream.
Shrieking Souls.disable: @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:44] (master) to comfort the spirit or @Check[type:occultism|dc:45] (master) to ward off the spirit

action->Scream.name: Scream
action->Scream.description:
Trigger A creature enters the area

Effect The spirit screams, dealing @Damage[(6d12+41)[sonic]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30] (@Check[type:fortitude|dc:40|basic:true]).

Sickle Blade.name: Sickle Blade
Sickle Blade.descriptionHazard: A skeletal arm holding a sickle is concealed in the ceiling and connected to a mechanism in the sliding door below it.
Sickle Blade.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:20|traits:action:disable-a-device] (trained) on the door frame or ceiling groove, or Interact to operate a lever on the opposite side of the door (in areas D2 and D4, respectively)
Sickle Blade.reset: The trap resets after 15 minutes. Additionally, a creature can manually Interact with the lever on the opposite side of the door to reset the trap.

action->Sickle.name: Sickle
action->Sickle.description:
Trigger A creature attempts to open the door

Effect A skeletal arm swings a sickle from the ceiling, making a Strike against the triggering creature.

action->Lancer.name: Lancer
action->Lancer.description: The skeletal knight uses a lance in one hand, even when it isn't mounted. If the skeletal knight critically hits a creature with its lance Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the start of the skeletal knight's next turn.

action->Circling Assault.name: Circling Assault
action->Circling Assault.description: The corpsekiller circles around their target then attacks, throwing their foe off balance and puncturing its defenses. The corpsekiller Steps or Strides, then attempts a glaive Strike. On a hit or critical hit, the Strike ignores 10 of their target's resistances. Regardless of the result of the Strike, the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} for 1 round.

action->Corpsekiller.name: Corpsekiller
action->Corpsekiller.description: A corpsekiller's Strikes affect incorporeal creatures as though etched with a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.JQdwHECogcTzdd8R]{Ghost Touch} property rune and deal an additional @Damage[2d8[slashing]] damage to undead creatures.

action->Flamboyant Reposition.name: Flamboyant Reposition
action->Flamboyant Reposition.description: With a flourish, a celebrant shrouds themself in a puff of smoke, glitter, or colorful ribbons. If the celebrant is adjacent to an enemy, they attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} that adjacent enemy. The celebrant Steps or Strides; they're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} during this movement.

action->Bolster Dead.name: Bolster Dead
action->Bolster Dead.description:
Frequency once per turn

Requirements Your most recent action was to cast a non-cantrip necromancy spell

Effect You harness the residual energy from the spell you last cast into the body of an undead creature within 30 feet. That creature's resistances increase by an amount equal to the rank of the spell cast until the beginning of the next turn.

action->Drain Bonded Item.name: Drain Bonded Item
action->Drain Bonded Item.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements The necromancer hasn't acted yet on this turn

Effect The necromancer expends the power stored in their dagger. This gives them the ability to cast one prepared spell they prepared today and already cast, without spending a spell slot.

Skewering Hall.name: Skewering Hall
Skewering Hall.descriptionHazard: A dozen spears hidden within sockets in the walls thrust into the hall when the pressure plate is triggered.

action->Skewer.name: Skewer
action->Skewer.description:
Trigger Pressure is applied to the pressure plate

Effect A dozen spears extend into the hall, making one spear Strike against each creature in the hall, up to a total of 12 spear Strikes.

Skull Fairy.name: Skull Fairy
Skull Fairy.publicNotes:
Skull fairies are malicious beings spawned from the heads of those who die after exposure to the malignant energies of the Shadow Plane. They aren't fey, but their petite, winged forms and tendency for malevolent mischief has caused the appellation "skull fairy" to stick.

After bursting from the skull of the deceased, a skull fairy seeks out victims to behead. Skull fairies enjoy nothing more than the horrific sound of wrenching a head free from a body. They often wear the skulls of their most recent victim like caps atop their bulbous, oversized heads. Skull fairies take heads they've acquired to isolated caves, where they carefully strip off the flesh and put the skulls on display. If the skull fairy feels the need for new headgear, they hollow out a fresh skull to wear and retire the old one to a place of prominence.
